Acerca del empleo
Company Description


BLEND360 is an acclaimed, forward-thinking Data, Digital Marketing, & AI Solutions Company, dedicated to fueling remarkable outcomes for our Fortune 500 clients. Our trajectory is one of continuous expansion, emerging at the crossroads of cutting-edge analytics, data proficiency, technology, and digital marketing excellence. We seek a Backend Developer to join our dynamic team, focusing primarily on backend development, utilizing technologies like Java, Spring suite, Containers, and Relational Databases in a synergistic and cooperative environment.


Job Description


In this role, you will be focusing on Backend Development, utilizing tools like Java, Spring suite (IoC/MVC/Boot/Security/Cloud/Stream), Containers, and Relational Databases. Your main responsibility will be to design and implement programs, ensuring code quality and aligning with industry best practices. This position requires a balance of technical acumen and effective communication skills, especially in the domain of IT and digital marketing.


What You Will Be Doing


Designing and implementing programs and maintaining alignment with industry best practices.
Extracting and documenting requirements for data, workflow, and system interfaces.
Translating functional needs into actionable programming directives.
Conducting technical evaluations and providing technology-driven feedback to higher management.
Providing indispensable technical support and addressing issues tied to the in-house application infrastructure.


Qualifications


Required Skills:


Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 4 years in the IT sector, specifically in digital marketing and analytics.
At least 2 years of experience in secure web application development.
Mastery over Object-Oriented Programming.


Nice To Have Skills


Familiarity with git, Java, Maven, Spring suite, JMS, Docker, Microservices, Cloud structures, REST API (Open API) development, Kubernetes, and Relational databases.


Education


Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.


Etc


Excellent communication, organization, customer service, and interpersonal skills.


Additional Information


Note: This full-time role does not allow for contract or C2C arrangements. For remote work options, candidates must reside within the United States, specifically in Arkansas, Colorado, Florida, Idaho, Illinois, Missouri, Tennessee, or Oklahoma.


The starting salary for this role is up to $107k per year. Actual compensation within the range will be dependent on several factors including but not limited to relevant experience, skills, certifications, training, and location. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range and determining factors for compensation are considered for each individual circumstance. BLEND360 also offers a competitive benefits program to meet the health and financial well-being of our team and their families. You can look forward to a range of benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401K, PTO, paid holidays, commuter benefits, spending accounts, life insurance, disability coverage, and EAPs.


A diverse workforce is a strong workforce


To deliver growth at BLEND360 and for our clients, we believe as a Talent Solutions Company, we have a responsibility and unique opportunity to positively impact the workforce. Diversity has played a critical role in our history, our growth, and continues to have a profound impact on our success.  We are determined to have equality in the workplace, within our team and as an extension of our clients’ team.


This is not the work of the moment, and this requires continued learning and purposeful actions.  We are investing resources to understand and improve the sourcing, selection and retention of the talent we hire, and ultimately the workforce we provide for our clients. We will communicate our journey in the spirit of transparency and shared learning.
